page.title: 03 Religions in Banbury
page.content: Marlborough Road Methodist Church was built in 1860. The Parish Church is St. Mary's. It is in the Horsefair. It has a big dome roof. St.Paul's is another Church of England, also St.Leonard's and St.Hugh's. Ruscote is a Methodist Church in the Fairway. Grimsbury Methodist was knocked down so they use St.Leonard's until a new one is built. There is a Baptist Church at Horsefair and a Friends' Meeting House as well. St. John's is a Roman Catholic Church in South Bar. The United Reform Church is in South Bar too. St.Joseph's is another R.C. Church. The Mosque is a house in Castle Street. The Muslims meet there. There are also some Sikhs - mainly in Grimsbury. The Mormons meet on Cherwell Heights. The Brethren meet on Kingsway.
